title: Global cost of living and rising prices - S4

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What's next in this story?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Detailed technical requirements coming in early 2026. That's when we'll see the specifics of what compliance actually looks like.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: So companies are in a waiting period?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: They can start preparing now with what we know, but yes, some details are still coming.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What should consumers watch for?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Look for changes in how AI companies communicate about their products. More transparency, clearer disclosures, better explanations of limitations.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That's actually a good thing.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: It should be. As one expert said, this is about steering innovation, not stopping it.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What about global implications?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: This could become the global standard. When the US and EU agree on something, others often follow.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: So this might be bigger than just US regulation.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Potentially, yes. We're watching the birth of global AI governance.
